lines.text: Put me on board.

[the boarding ramp fence comes under attack]
You were right, Stanton. You're a better judge of character than I am.
lines.character: Dr. Cole Hendron, Astronomer at Cosmos Observatory

lines.text: Put me on board!
No, Stanton.
lines.character: Dr. Cole Hendron, Astronomer at Cosmos Observatory

lines.text: [Pushes him away from the ramp]
What are you doing?

[Uncovers and pulls a secret lever that closes the ark's hatch]
*We're* the extra fuel that they need. The new world doesn't belong to us; it belongs to the young.
lines.character: Dr. Cole Hendron, Astronomer at Cosmos Observatory

lines.text: Your salvation doesn't interest me; mine does.
If our calculations prove to be correct, this will be the most frightening discovery of all time.

[Presumably he wrote this line on a banner hanging over the Space Ark camp]
Waste anything except TIME. Time is our shortest material.
lines.character: Dr. Cole Hendron, Astronomer at Cosmos Observatory

lines.text: money to burn!
Dr. Frye, how's your heart?

[puzzled]
Fine.
lines.character: Dr. George Frye, Dean of Eastern School of Technology

lines.text:
[to Dr. Tony Drake]
You invented those electrocardiograms for my benefit!
[first lines]

[spoken over a shot of outer space]
Needles in a heavenly haystack. There are more stars in the heavens than there are human beings on Earth. Through telescopes men of science constantly search the infinitesimal corners of our solar system seeking new discoveries, hoping to better understand the laws of the Universe. Observatories dedicated to the study of astronomy are set in high and remote places, but there is none more remote than Mt. Kenna Observatory in this part of South Africa.
It's dog eat dog - the law of the jungle!

[handing him money]
You will require this for expenses.

[counting the money and finding it short]
I'm supposed to get paid $1500 plus the expenses.
Hendron will pay you on delivery. Time is all that counts. The money doesn't matter at all.
With me, doctor, money always matters.
Perhaps now, but the day may arrive when money won't mean anything, not to you... nor anyone.
When that happens to me, I'll be six feet under.
[Randall is taken aback when Bronson just stares at him intently puffing on his pipe]
Without me you would have been wiped out with the rest of them.
our chance of reaching the new world is as thin as your chance of ever becoming a humanitarian.
lines.character: Dr. Cole Hendron, Astronomer at Cosmos Observatory

lines.text:
[breathing in]
Best air I ever tasted.

[Interrupting a meeting, one day before the end]
I'm sorry, I'll come back later.
No, no, Eddie, come right in. We can't put things off 'til later.
lines.character: Dr. George Frye, Dean of Eastern School of Technology

lines.text:
[Leaves his winning seat token on the desk]
I just wanted to leave this for someone else to use.
[Turns and leaves the room]
Julie Cummings. I guess he doesn't want to leave her.
lines.character: Dr. George Frye, Dean of Eastern School of Technology

lines.text: He'll be home the day after tomorrow.
All right. I'm in here safe and sound. Go outside and read the magazines.
